Famous Cities of India, Hot Destinations of India
Cities of India are a mesmerizing portrait that adorns the world of travel and tourism with their sheer beauty and diversity. Holidays in the attractive cities of India like Delhi, Mumbai, Goa, Kolkata, Agra, Varanasi, Shimla, Jaipur, Udaipur, Mysore, Kochi, Chennai are full of delights with an average maximum winter temperatures range from the high 20 degree Celsius in the South to below freezing in parts of Kashmir, Leh and Ladakh, and the low 20 degree Celsius in the northern plains. In summer, the North is generally hotter than the South, with daytime temperatures usually over 40 degree Celsius and in parts of the North West up to nearly 50 degree Celsius from time to time. Night time temperatures also remain high. These cities not only carry the glory and aura of their past but also ever evolving psyche of the people. Culture, history and lifestyle radiates from everywhere in these cities. These cities not only differ with each other in landscape but also in the economic development. These cities are maintaining a fine balance between tradition and modernity. It would be really interesting for a tourist to visit and admire these amazing complexes of yore.
